items.preText: 1.29pm Matt Henry will open the bowling for New Zealand. Tamim and Soumya are in the middle. Tamim will be on strike first up. Two slips in place 1.25pm Thanks Ankur. Well, the anthems are ongoing in the middle, and it's almost go time! Ovy: "A very bad toss to lose. Should hang in there for first 10 overs. Come on Tamim!" Shorif Uddin : "Finally, the match time has come! It's a 'Eid day' (Biggest Festiva) in Bangladesh and I we are eagerly waiting for another gigantic victory in the eve of Shakib Al Hasan's landmark 200th ODI. I am from Sylhet, the City of rain in Bangladesh. To avoid all sort of problem, especially electricity, I have charged my two smartphones, purchase internet big data package. Now, It's only tigers time to show a memorable performance for their mad fans! " Abhijato: "Mr Brickhill, you're shifting comms feed duties faster than India are shifting through the Proteas batsmen. What's your prediction for this one? You're a neutral here, after all, so no jinxes either ways. What's your take?" -- Oof! Tough call, but I reckon this could be Bangladesh's game. Shorif Uddin : "Liam, would you mind informing us about the weather whether any possibility of incessant rainfall? " -- At the moment, it's set fair. As soon as that changes, I'll let you know Bangladesh have a stiff challenge at hand given the overhead conditions and the form of the New Zealand pace attack that not only decimated Sri Lanka in Cardiff but also skittled India out for a paltry 179 in the warm-up at The Oval. On that note, it's time to turn over the strike to Liam Brickhill, who will take you through to drinks. Rumman: "How is the pitch? Any grass? What you feel can be a par score? " It's a fresh pitch with reasonable grass cover. But in England, it's wiser to look overhead instead and there's a bit of cloud cover. Bangladesh: Tamim Iqbal, Soumya Sarkar, Shakib Al Hasan, Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), Mohammad Mithun, Mahmudullah, Mosaddek Hossain, Mohammad Saifuddin, Mehedi Hasan, Mashrafe Mortaza (c), Mustafizur Rahman New Zealand:: Martin Guptill, Colin Munro, Kane Williamson (capt), Ross Taylor, Tom Latham (wk), James Neesham, Colin de Grandhomme, Mitchell Santner, Matt Henry, Lockie Ferguson, Trent Boult Mashrafe: Would have liked to bowl. It's not going to be easy but need to hang in there. Playing the same team Williamson: We're going to bowl, it's a fresh surface. It was a good performance against Sri Lanka but you prepare and adapt for the new opposition. Playing the same team. New Zealand opt to field How Bangladesh began their World Cup opener against South Africa had a lot to do with the result. The man instrumental in providing that early impetus, Soumya Sarkar, reckons the first ten overs will be crucial again. Zaman: "Good Afternoon from Germany Ankur. Lunch done, Boss isn't in the office, have a livecam opened which is showing lovely Central London with scattered clouds but nothing ominous to ponder the game as I can see, hopefully it remains so the whole game! Now waiting for a fascinating contest. " Leave out Zimbabwe, and New Zealand have been Bangladesh's third-most regular opponents in international cricket. Here's Sidharth Monga on How two rivals have shown familiarity breeds respect Zain: "From London Eagerly waiting to see How BD tigers perform today. Concerned with the bowling department and Tamims form. Recently he is quite out of touch. Today's match will prove whether BD a team just upsets bigger teams or they promoted themselves to the dominant force. " SHAHED : "Hi Ankur, what's the weather there? If overcast, Bangladesh should field first given the chance. What's your opinion? " The weather's likely to be cloudy for most of the day but it's a tough one given that Bangladesh's spinners could come into play later. Besides, this isn't the usual 10:30 am start. Bangladesh have appeared quietly confident about the fact that they aren't merely making the numbers this time, the comfortable win over South Africa only reaffirming that. New Zealand, on the other hand were so dominant in their opener against Sri Lanka that it's almost hard to know what kind of form the majority of their players are in. The Oval pitch has been on the drier side, which should suit Bangladesh. "Vibe outside is boisterous," Isam thunders as he makes his way to the ground. 12.20pm Warm welcome to all of you for the second of our Wednesday double-headers. India are finally underway and are making a right royal mess of South Africa's plans in Southampton. Eighty miles down the road on M3, two "dangerous underdogs" have a great chance to prove they are genuine contenders. I'm Shashank Kishore Ankur Dhawan bringing you all the action from The Oval. Stay locked. Mohammad Isam and Sidharth Monga are our reporters at the venue today. Andrew Miller is on our #LiveReport.
items.text: Henry finds a touch of lift in the channel outside off, but Tamim rides it well to defend to point
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: fuller this time from Henry, searching for any early movement. Tamim is forward to smother it
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: flicked fine! There is some swing for Henry, but it's in to Tamim and starts too straight. Tamim's just got to help it on its way to collect four, and noise erupts from the stands
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

items.text: good riposte from the bowler, who pulls his length back and straightens his line to burst a length ball past Tamim's outside edge
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: and now he aims full again, but again it's a little too straight. Tamim flicks off his legs, but finds midwicket inside the circle
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: Shamim Rahman : "I think it's a good toss to lose. In fact it is better to defend NZ than chasing. I believe 280+ is okay for BD today. "
items.text: and Henry ends the over with another length delivery, Tamim propping half forward to defend. Did this keep a little low? Seemed like it, from Tamim's reaction
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: Boult from the other end. Henry found some swing, Boult should too. He's also got two slips awaiting an edge
items.text: some shape away from the left hander first up, and Soumya thrusts his hands out at the ball to collect a single to third man
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.preText: Joynul: "@shorif, i am from sylhet too, sagor dighir par, for electricity problem, i connect my TV with IPS. So, no problem there. You could do that. "
items.text: zippy from Boult, and Tamim lets it through outside off
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: snaking away from an off stump line, and Tamim holds his back inside the line to let the ball pass him
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: fuller of length this time, but the line is slightly too straight and he's clipped into space at midwicket for one
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: excellent line from Boult, attacking the top of off, and Soumya is only half forward as he taps it to cover
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.preText: Tanvir Ahmed: "Gonna enjoy the match which will be shown later as "Highlights of 2nd win" #Road to victory #CWC 2019 #Champion Bangladesh" -- Big call. Early days!
items.text: Soumya's a little squared up by this one, and a thick outside edge rolls through gully, allowing a single
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: there's a yelp of alarm from the bowler as this one shapes in and almost sneaks through, but Soumya's bat comes down in time and he picks a gap at midwicket for a brace
items.shortText: Henry to Soumya Sarkar, 2 runs

items.text: angled across the left hander, who steps into a forward push to cover
items.shortText: Henry to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: massive swipe across the line! What's he thinking? Henry has strung a couple of dots together, and so Soumya lines up a huge mow into the leg side, hitting nothing. Fortunately for him, the ball flies wide of the off stump and through to the keeper
items.shortText: Henry to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: Henry gets this one to spit off a length, and there's a touch of fend to Soumya's defensive push
items.shortText: Henry to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: another big drive from Soumya, and he's a little too early into the shot. Instead of going through mid off, where he was aiming, the ball rolls to mid on
items.shortText: Henry to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.preText: Vinod Rajpal: "@Joynul & @shorif : Its better to use the internet data package on Cricinfo commentary , Its better than watching a live match - I follow Cricinfo !!"
items.text: nippy finish to the over from Henry, curving a 139km/h delivery in towards middle and off. Soumya's defence holds firm, however
items.shortText: Henry to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: through the hands of extra cover! That's a misfield, and it's brought two runs. Tamim stood tall to spank a length ball to cover, and it was hit really hard, but the fielder got hands to it and should have stopped that
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, 2 runs

items.text: a touch fuller from Boult, and this time Tamim defends
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: bouncer from Boult, and Tamim hurries to duck underneath it
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: Shorif Uddin : "@Joynul, I am very near to you Modina Market area. I pesumed such electricity problem may arises. Thus took al sort of measures so that cannot deprive of watching Shakib Al Hasan's landmark match. Sympathy for you..... You can visit my residents. It's only take about five minutes. "
items.text: exquisite from Tamim! Boult pitched this right up, searching for swing, but Tamim just flicked his wrists through the line to send the ball scorching to the midwicket boundary
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

items.preText: Hridoy: "Last 2 years only 2 win against NZ for Bangladesh But one of them is historic win in champions trophy here in Cardiff. Can be match of the world cup is waiting for us today."
items.text: forced, on the up, to cover, where Neesham tumbles to cut it off
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: Abhijato: "I am calling this the Clash Of The Dark Horses. Against stronger teams like India and England, winning will be very tough. Against Australia too. That leaves six matches, out of which one has been played won by each team already. Hence, whoever wins today has a much greater chance of making it to the Top Four. #ArmchairOpinion"
items.text: Tamim hops into a defensive push to end the over, and the field closes in to stop any thoughts of a single
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: a neat forward push is quickly stopped at cover
items.shortText: Henry to Soumya Sarkar, no run
